item.description:
@hellwsfull wrote:

[quote=“theron105, post:28, topic:291645”]to give a donator right you have to open their character .txt document or w\e it is go down till you see donate or donato 0 take the 0 and make t a 1 then go to data folder and there will be a donator.txt document you type there nam in it ad save it thn they are a donator and there are only 4 rights btw people
0-payer
1-mod
2-admin
3-owner
4-hidden admin

this will only change or be diffrent if you mae them that way[/quote]

thank you it works but now i still need icon some 1 that can help me with that? thanks!

item.title: How u give donator
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“madbob420, post:23, topic:291645”]Hellwsfull,
This is the only thing I am going to say.
Make commands, that you ONLY tell people that donate.
Because obviously you’re a noob coder.
Make your donators agree that they WONT use the commands
when there donation package has expired or there BANNED!

Bye…[/quote]That’s the most ridiculous idea I’ve heard of, of course they are going to tell other people, and use them when their donation package has expired, the best thing to do is use a higher player right, such as 20.

Commands:

if (command.startsWith("##CommandName##") && playerRights == 20)) { teleportToX = 2191; teleportToY = 2371; }

For objects/items/action buttons:

case ##ID##: if (playerRights == 20) { teleportToX = 2191; teleportToY = 2371; MSG("You teleported to the donators island by the tree in Gnome Village!"); MSG("Here, take a free 50K.); addItem(995, 50000); }

item.title: How u give donator
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

The command you posted would only work for players 6+ rights, that does not mean the player right exists.

I never said anything against that, take a look at these commands and it may help you.

else if (command.startsWith("Hi") && playerRights == 2)) { MESSAGE("Hi, you're obviously an administrator!") }
playerRights == 2 meaning the player is an administrator to use the command

else if (command.startsWith("Hi") && playerRights == 3)) { MESSAGE("Hi, you're obviously an owner!") }
playerRights == 3 meaning the player is an owner to use the command

else if (command.startsWith("Hi") && playerRights == 1)) { MESSAGE("Hi, you're obviously a player moderator!") }
playerRights == 1 meaning the player is a player moderator to use the command

else if (command.startsWith("Hi") && playerRights >= 2)) { MESSAGE("Hi, you're obviously an administrator or higher!") }
playerRights >= 2 meaning the player is an administrator or higher to use the command

The player rights 4 and above do not exist, the command just works if the player has 4 player rights, it isn’t a real player right until you completely add it though.

Read full topic

item.title: How u give donator
item.dc:creator: @madbob420 madbob420
item.description:
@madbob420 wrote:

No,
Administrators are limited also.
Owners have the power to do what ever they want and wish.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 29 July 2009, 03:58:45[/size][hr][quote=“Telenim, post:17, topic:291645”]Apparently you don’t know what you’re talking about, if you had 4 player rights and changed them to 5 or any higher, no differences would be made, the server only allows several commands to be used for 4 rights because they’re using playerRights >= 2 when the commands have been added, meaning all player rights 2 and higher would let them use that command.

If you would like me to explain better, and show proof, I will do so by PM or I can add you on MSN/AIM/Yahoo

Noobie22, you’re also wrong, the owner rights are 3, “hidden admin” rights are 4, the only thing same about them is that they can use 20% of the commands.[/quote]
Grrr… I’m getting tired of telling you people…
If it don’t work you have a brain dead source.
If you wish here, I’ll provide some proof.

if (command.startsWith("COMMAND") && playerRights > 5) { yell(""+playerName+" THIS WORKS ON MY SERVER!"); toX = TELEX; toY = TELEY; }
This works on my server 100%.

Read full topic

item.title: How u give donator
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

Apparently you don’t know what you’re talking about, if you had 4 player rights and changed them to 5 or any higher, no differences would be made, the server only allows several commands to be used for 4 rights because they’re using playerRights >= 2 when the commands have been added, meaning all player rights 2 and higher would let them use that command.

If you would like me to explain better, and show proof, I will do so by PM or I can add you on MSN/AIM/Yahoo

Noobie22, you’re also wrong, the owner rights are 3, “hidden admin” rights are 4, the only thing same about them is that they can use 20% of the commands.

Read full topic

item.title: How u give donator
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

Madbob420, 4 and 5 don’t exist, they just have access to all commands because people are using ‘>=’ when they add the players rights for each command, to do this you’d just create a higher player right and load a different crown.

Read full topic

item.title: How u give donator
item.dc:creator: @madbob420 madbob420
item.description:
@madbob420 wrote:

Okay people aren’t quite uderstanding.
0 = Player (No Crown)
1 = Player Moderator (Player Moderator Crown)
2 = Administrator (Administraton Crown)
3 = Owner (Administraton Crown)
4 = Hidden Administrator (No Crown)
5 = Hidden Owner (No Crown) == [More Rights then, Hidden Administrator]

Anything above these don’t Exist.
Technically if you would want a Donations spot.
You would have to code the Crown Modeler and all of that good coding.
If you do work on coding your own Crown Modeler I personally bid you good luck.

Read full topic
